The claim is made by Josh Hawley: Missouri's attorney general and Republican candidate for U.S. Senate, who has been campaigning on the effects of the Affordable Care Act.
The claim is supported by an op: ed written by Hawley in the Springfield News-Leader, where he states that millions of Americans have lost their health care plans since the implementation of the Affordable Care Act.
The claim is further supported by a Wash: which discusses cancellation notices sent out by insurance providers to individuals with grandfathered plans that did not meet ACA standards.
Benjamin Sommers: an associate professor of health policy and economics at Harvard University, states that while it is possible that some individuals who received cancellation notices lost health care coverage, most would have been able to obtain new coverage, potentially even at lower costs through subsidized plans under the ACA.
